content.description: Pretty fantastic.To the right of the Chupacabra start you will find another large, diagonal loaf rail (closer to the close tree). Start matched here. Toss up and left to the crimp pinch, then move up and right to the in-cut vertical slot side-pull. Either bump up or jump to the juggy featured ledge. Mantle over the ledge and continue up the second short face above to top out.

Pretty great, this one could go at three stars as well.Around the corner from the steep short face (a few feet right of Lock Ness Arete) on the far left of the taller, rear, more vertical face.Find the very low, long, diagonal crimp rail  and sit start matched.With funky feet lock off to a good/slopey jug. Manage inventive flag footwork to move on to the flake and jugs. Finish with delicate slab work to better jugs directly up.

This one is short and sweet.To the right of "Crackula" you will find the low, long crack seam at the low steepness. There is a fat section of the seam low on the arete corner. Start matched here.Overhead are nice slopey/juggy rails and crimps above. Sit start in the seam and work to the lip. Work over the lip direct for the technical but not-so-bad top out.
Sit start on the same feature and Crackula, but on the right side of the starting block.Move up to the left facing side-pull overhead and then out right to join into Lock-Ness to top out as per.

I don't usually give 3 stars to a problem like this but this one is pretty cool.Jason Johnson bagged the FA of this one. Short but awesome!Sit start (at the steep, short face) on the obvious low chunk ledge in the cut. Match the ledge with a heel hook and grab the steep crack. Follow the thin crack seam up to the jugs at the lip and roll over.

Start on the low, long, nice loaf rail (to the right of Mothman) as per Chupacabra Left.  

  Off the start reach straight up overhead to the right facing thin crimp sidepull. Establish on this and make a huge tension lock-off to the distant tiny pinch. Make another long move with a cross-over to a nice, huge jug ledge. Finish direct through juggy ledges and good holds.

To the right of Mothman find the long, fat, diagonal loaf rail low to the ground. To the left of this will be a gaston edge.Start matched on the loaf rail with a right heel. Move left into the gaston and traverse left to finish as per the top of Mothman.

Short this line has but perfect holds. 

  Sit start to the furthest right portion of the rear face on the lowest horizontal crimp rail, and the higher diagonal rail to the upper right. 

  Pull on and toss to the higher left gaston crimp. Move up to the distant jug at the lip and top out with easy style.

This boulder has just about everything. Easy and hard problems, powerful moves and technical sequences, vertical to steep faces, lowball and highball lines, a good landing, and lots of problems to choose from. Its only downside is its hike out, but if that type of thing stops you than you most likely wont be in the Wildwood in the first place.
